bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 128 (Tuesday, July 25, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. VICENTE GONZALEZ of Texas:H.R. 4868.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To revise requirements related to the terms and lendinglimits of certain credit union loans.Specifically, the bill (1) allows the National Credit UnionAdministration Board to lengthen the maturity term of certainloans made by a credit union, and (2) raises the credit limitfor credit union member businesses under which such loans areexcluded from overall credit union lending limits.[Page H3951]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Member Business Loan Expansion Act

This bill revises requirements related to the terms and lending limits of certain credit union loans.

Specifically, the bill (1) allows the National Credit Union Administration Board to lengthen the maturity term of certain loans made by a credit union, and (2) raises the credit limit for credit union member businesses under which such loans are excluded from overall credit union lending limits.

Finally, the bill expands the definition of a community financial institution by (1) allowing insured credit unions to qualify, and (2) raising the average asset limit. (Community financial institutions are subject to reduced asset requirements for purposes of Federal Home Loan Bank membership.)

bill.title: Member Business Loan Expansion Act

item.title: To amend the Federal Credit Union Act to provide more loan flexibility to credit unions, to amend the Federal Home Loan Bank Act to expand homeownership access, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
